ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Van Allen Probe B Energetic Particle, Composition, and Thermal Plasma Suite (ECT) Helium Oxygen Proton Electron, HOPE, Mass Spectrometer Pitch Angle resolved Science Data. Electron Fluxes, 15 eV to 50 keV, and Ion Fluxes, 1 eV to 50 keV, as measured in alternate Spin Cadence, Level 3, Release #4 (L3), 11.35 s Data

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata

Added DOI and PublicationInfo minted by LFB, updated InformationURL URLs as needed, updated the SPDF MetadataContact Person to Robert M. Candey, metadata updated to SPASE 2.4.1, reviewed by LFB 20220818

Updated PublishedBy name to match ROR Registry. Added ResourceType and NamingAuthority. Changed http to https in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Fixed version number separator in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Matched version number in schemaLocation attribute to updated value in Version tag. ZCB

ResourceHeader.Description: Van Allen Probe B, Energetic Particle, Composition, and Thermal Plasma Suite, ECT, Helium Oxygen Proton Electron, HOPE, Mass Spectrometer Pitch Angle resolved Science Data. Electron Fluxes from about 15 eV to 50 keV and Ion Fluxes from about 1 eV to 50 keV as measured in alternate Spin Cadence.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: H.O. Funsten, R. Skoug, R. Friedel. Distribute freely, please acknowledge the original Principal Investigator. Please contact the Principal Investigator before any publication or Presentation of Data.

Parameter.Name: Electron Differential Flux Intensity, Omnidirectional
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH_ELE
Parameter.Description: Electron Differential Flux Intensity, Omnidirectional, Energies from ~15 eV to ~50 keV
Parameter.Caveats: Flux integrated, piecewise constant, over 11 Pitch Angles and 20 Gyro Angles as computed by using the Magnetic Field Direction crossed with the Spacecraft Spin Axis, and over 72 Energies. Note that the Data have been expanded to the highest possible Resolution. Before September 2013, the transmitted Data were collapsed to 36 Energies and 4-8-16-8-4 Spin Angles in order to meet Telemetry Allocation Restrictions.

Parameter.Name: Electron Differential Flux Intensity, Omnidirectional, Time Series Stack Plots
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH_ELE
Parameter.Description: Electron Differential Flux Intensity, Omnidirectional, Time Series Stack Plots, Energies from ~15 eV to ~50 keV, with Perigee Mode excluded
Parameter.Caveats: Flux integrated, piecewise constant, over 11 Pitch Angles and 20 Gyro Angles as computed by using the Magnetic Field Direction crossed with the Spacecraft Spin Axis, and over 72 Energies. Note that the Data have been expanded to the highest possible Resolution. Before September 2013, the transmitted Data were collapsed to 36 Energies and 4-8-16-8-4 Spin Angles in order to meet Telemetry Allocation Restrictions. This parameter is virtual. It is calculated by calling the function APPLY_ESA_QFLAG with the following input parameters: FEDO, Mode_Ele.

Parameter.Name: Electron Differential Flux Intensity, Unidirectional, Energy-Angle Plasmagrams

Parameter.Name: Data Quality Flag Type Descriptions, Electron Data
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH_ELE
Parameter.Description: Data Quality Flag Type Descriptions, Electron Data
Parameter.Caveats: Flags to indicate potential Issues with Electron Data. Each Element of this Array contains the Flag Status for a particular Concern. See the FLAGS Variable for a Description of each Element.

Parameter.Name: Data Quality Flag Type Descriptions, Ion Data
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH_ION
Parameter.Description: Data Quality Flag Type Descriptions, Ion Data
Parameter.Caveats: Flags to indicate potential Issues with Ion Data. Each Element of this Array contains the Flag Status for a particular Concern. A Value of Zero of r a particular File Type indicates no unusual Concerns of that Type for that Time Sample. Increasing Flag Values indicate increasing Concern. See the FLAGS Variable for a Description of each Element.

Parameter.Name: Instrument Data Mode, Electron
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH_ELE
Parameter.Description: Instrument Data Mode, Electron
Parameter.Caveats: Indicates the Instrument Mode for the Data Collection. Each Instrument Mode has a different Set of Energy Channels. See the corresponding HOPE_ENERGY_Electron Record. 0=Apogee Mode: Normal Operation, 1=Perigee Mode: Minimum Energy Channel raised during the Pass through Perigee, 2=Burst Mode: Subset of Energies sampled at rapid Cadence.

Parameter.Name: Instrument Data Mode, Ion
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH_ION
Parameter.Description: Instrument Data Mode, Ion
Parameter.Caveats: Indicates the Instrument Mode for the Data Collection. Each Instrument Mode has a different Set of Energy Channels. Parameter.Name: HOPE Electron Differential Counts, Omnidirectional
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH_ELE
Parameter.Description: HOPE Electron Differential Counts, Omnidirectional
Parameter.Caveats: Counts summed over over 72 Energies and over 20 Gyro Angles and 11 Pitch Angles as computed by using the Magnetic Field Direction crossed with the Spacecraft Spin Axis. Note that the Data have been expanded to the highest possible Resolution. Before September 2013, the transmitted Data were collapsed to 36 Energies and 4-8-16-8-4 Spin Angles in order to meet Telemetry Allocation Restrictions.

Parameter.Name: HOPE Electron Differential Counts, Directional
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH_ELE
Parameter.Description: HOPE Electron Differential Counts, Directional, not for Plotting. Column 1 Labels from PITCH_ANGLE: [ 4.50000, 18.0000, 36.0000, 54.0000, 72.0000, 90.0000, 108.000, 126.000, 144.000, 162.000, 175.500]
Parameter.Caveats: Counts as a Function of 72 Energies and 11 Pitch Angles as computed by using the Magnetic Field Direction crossed with the Spacecraft Spin Axis. Note that the Data have been expanded to the highest possible Resolution. Before September 2013, the transmitted Data were collapsed to 36 Energies and 4-8-16-8-4 Spin Angles in order to meet Telemetry Allocation Restrictions. The Counts are summed over all Measurements in each Pitch Angle/Gyro Angle Bin.

Parameter.Name: Number of Samples in the Summation, Electron Differential Flux Intensity, Omnidirectional
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH_ELE
Parameter.Description: Number of Samples in the Summation, Electron Differential Flux Intensity, Omnidirectional, not for Plotting
Parameter.Caveats: Number of Samples used in computing the Flux summed over Pitch Angle. Note that the Data have been expanded to the highest possible Resolution (16 Spin angles, 72 Energies). Before September 2013, the transmitted Data were collapsed to 36 Energies and 4-8-16-8-4 Spin Angles in order to meet Telemetry Allocation Restrictions.

Parameter.Name: Model Spacecraft Magnetic Field Magnitude, Electrons
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH_ELE
Parameter.Description: Model Spacecraft Magnetic Field Magnitude, Electron Time Base
Parameter.Caveats: The Model Magnetic Field Data was interpolated from the 1 min Magnetic Field Ephemeris Time Resolution to match the Electron Measurement Time Base. Calculated by using the LANLGeoMag Software Library. Internal Magnetic Field Model: International Geomagnetic Reference Field, IGRF. External Magnetic Field Model: Olson-Pfitzer 1977 Quiet, OP77Q. Average Type: standard

Parameter.Name: Spacecraft Position Vector, Geographic Cartesian Coordinates, Electrons
Parameter.Set: Time Series defined by using: EPOCH_ELE
Parameter.Description: Spacecraft Position Vector, Geographic, GEO, Cartesian Coordinates, Electron Time Base
Parameter.Caveats: The Origin is the Center of Mass of the Earth. The X-Axis points to the Intersection of the Greenwich Meridian and Geographic Equator. The Z Axis points to the Geographic North Pole. The Y Axis completes the Right-Handed Cartesian Triad with Y = -X × Z.
